intro: Xanthidium ambrosioides, commonly known as the Mexican datura, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous annual that grows up to 1.5 meters tall, featuring thick, hairy stems and alternate, ovate leaves. The plant produces large, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically purple or violet in color, blooming in the evening. Its fruit is a spiny capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Xanthidium ambrosioides is known for its potent alkaloids, which have been used traditionally in medicine and ritual practices.
